title: The 20 photographs of the week
text:
Abaco Island, Bahamas

A man walks over what remains of homes in the area called the Mudd after it was devastated by Hurricane Dorian. Dorian was one of the most powerful Caribbean storms on record , a category 5 hurricane with winds of 200mph. It stalled over the Bahamas for nearly two days, becoming the worst disaster in the nation’s history. Large swaths of Greater Abaco Island were destroyed. In the hard-hit Mudd section of the island, search crews have used geotagging technology to mark the locations of bodies.
description: Hurricane Dorian, protests in Hong Kong, fashion weeks in London and New York and the burning Amazon – the last seven days, as captured by the world’s best photojournalists
